page.title: 20Farming,Stebbing Essex
page.content: The land in our part of Essex is some of the richest farmland in the country There is very intensive arable farming and most farms are between 100 and 200 acres.Farming is highly mechanised and a farm can be efficiently run by only two or three men using sophisticated machinery.The main crops are wheat,barley and potatoes.Some sugar beet is grown,but since acreage was limited by the Common Market ,farmers grow less.They now grow quite a lot of oil seed rape,which is used in cooking oils and margarine. There are some poultry farms producing eggs,but virtually no other livestock,apart from a herd of Highland cattle and many horses and ponies.
